text: The European Green Deal is a set of policy plans by the European Commission with the aim of making Europe climate neutral in 2050. It will increase the EU's greenhouse gas emission reductions target for 2030 to at least 50% and towards 55% compared with 1990 levels. The (Net-Zero Industry law, or) Net- Zero Industry Act was signed into law (2024's second quarter), by authorities of the EU.https://www.euronews.com/green/2024/05/27/net-zero-industry-act- sign-off-heralds-carbon-capture-deployment. Retrieved 2024-05-29 Earlier (December 13, 2019) the European Council decided to approve the plan, with a rejection from Poland. On 15 January 2020 the European Parliament voted to support the deal as well. The president of the European Commission, Ursula von der Leyen, said that the European Green Deal would be Europe's "man on the Moon moment", as the plan would make Europe the first climate-neutral continent. Von der Leyen appointed Frans Timmermans as Executive Vice President of the European Commission for the European Green Deal. ==References== Category:European Union Category:December 2019 events Category:January 2020 events
